title: Saturday STEM Lab Mentor for 6th-8th Grade Girls
description: Volunteer mentors support a small cohort of 6th-8th grade girls in a Saturday STEM lab focused on robotics, circuitry, and creative problem solving. Volunteers guide hands-on activities, help students reflect on their projects, and encourage their progress using provided lesson plans and kits. A background check is required and volunteers are asked to commit to at least four Saturdays from 10am-1pm.
source_excerpt:
Northside Community Center is launching a Saturday STEM lab for 6th-8th grade girls focused on robotics, circuitry, and creative problem solving. Mentors guide a cohort of eight students through hands-on builds, help them reflect on what worked, and celebrate small wins.

We provide lesson plans, kits, and staff support; you bring patience, curiosity, and confidence working with tweens. Background check required. Ideal volunteers can commit to at least four Saturdays from 10am-1pm.
